verses.text: In the \w six|strong="H8337"\w* and \w thirtieth|strong="H7970"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of the \w reign|strong="H4438"\w* of \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* \w Baasha|strong="H1201"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* came \w up|strong="H5927"\w* against \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and \w built|strong="H1129"\w* \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w*, to the intent \w that|strong="H1115"\w* he might \w let|strong="H5414"\w* none go \w out|strong="H3318"\w* or come \w in|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*.

Then \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* brought \w out|strong="H3318"\w* \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* out of the \w treasures|strong="H0214"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* and of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w Ben-hadad|strong="H1130"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Syria|strong="H0758"\w*, that \w dwelt|strong="H3427"\w* at \w Damascus|strong="H1834"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,\f + \fr 16.2 \ft Damascus: Heb. Darmesek\f*

\add There is\add* a \w league|strong="H1285"\w* between me and thee, as \add there was\add* between my \w father|strong="H0001"\w* and thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w*: behold, I have \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* thee \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*; \w go|strong="H3212"\w*, \w break|strong="H6565"\w* thy \w league|strong="H1285"\w* with \w Baasha|strong="H1201"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, that he may \w depart|strong="H5927"\w* from me.

And \w Ben-hadad|strong="H1130"\w* \w hearkened|strong="H8085"\w* unto \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w*, and \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* the \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of his \w armies|strong="H2428"\w* against the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*; and they \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Ijon|strong="H5859"\w*, and \w Dan|strong="H1835"\w*, and \w Abel-maim|strong="H0066"\w*, and all the \w store|strong="H4543"\w* \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Naphtali|strong="H5321"\w*.\f + \fr 16.4 \ft his: Heb. which were his\f*

And it came to pass, when \w Baasha|strong="H1201"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* \add it\add*, that he left \w off|strong="H2308"\w* \w building|strong="H1129"\w* of \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w*, and let his \w work|strong="H4399"\w* \w cease|strong="H7673"\w*.

Then \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* all \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*; and they carried \w away|strong="H5375"\w* the \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* of \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w*, and the \w timber|strong="H6086"\w* thereof, wherewith \w Baasha|strong="H1201"\w* was \w building|strong="H1129"\w*; and he \w built|strong="H1129"\w* therewith \w Geba|strong="H1387"\w* and \w Mizpah|strong="H4709"\w*.

¶ And at that \w time|strong="H6256"\w* \w Hanani|strong="H2607"\w* the \w seer|strong="H7200"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Because thou hast \w relied|strong="H8172"\w* on the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Syria|strong="H0758"\w*, and not \w relied|strong="H8172"\w* on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, therefore is the \w host|strong="H2428"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Syria|strong="H0758"\w* \w escaped|strong="H4422"\w* out of thine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.

Were not the \w Ethiopians|strong="H3569"\w* and the \w Lubims|strong="H3864"\w* a \w huge|strong="H7230"\w* \w host|strong="H2428"\w*, with \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w many|strong="H7235"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w* and \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*? yet, because thou didst \w rely|strong="H8172"\w* on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, he \w delivered|strong="H5414"\w* them into thine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.\f + \fr 16.8 \ft a huge: Heb. in abundance\f*

For the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* run to and \w fro|strong="H7751"\w* throughout the whole \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, to shew himself \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* in the behalf of \add them\add* whose \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* \add is\add* \w perfect|strong="H8003"\w* toward him. Herein thou hast done \w foolishly|strong="H5528"\w*: therefore from \w henceforth|strong="H6258"\w* thou shalt \w have|strong="H3426"\w* \w wars|strong="H4421"\w*.\f + \fr 16.9 \ft to shew…: or, strongly to hold with them, etc\f*

Then \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* was \w wroth|strong="H3707"\w* with the \w seer|strong="H7200"\w*, and \w put|strong="H5414"\w* him in a \w prison|strong="H4115"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; for \add he was\add* in a \w rage|strong="H2197"\w* with him because of this \add thing\add*. And \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* \w oppressed|strong="H7533"\w* \add some\add* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* the same \w time|strong="H6256"\w*.\f + \fr 16.10 \ft oppressed: Heb. crushed\f*

¶ And, behold, the \w acts|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w*, \w first|strong="H7223"\w* and \w last|strong="H0314"\w*, lo, they \add are\add* \w written|strong="H3789"\w* in the \w book|strong="H5612"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

And \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* in the \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w ninth|strong="H8672"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4438"\w* was \w diseased|strong="H2456"\w* in his \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*, until his \w disease|strong="H2483"\w* \add was\add* \w exceeding|strong="H4605"\w* \add great:\add* yet in his \w disease|strong="H2483"\w* he \w sought|strong="H1875"\w* not to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, but to the \w physicians|strong="H7495"\w*.

¶ And \w Asa|strong="H0609"\w* \w slept|strong="H7901"\w* with his \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*, and \w died|strong="H4191"\w* in the \w one|strong="H0259"\w* and \w fortieth|strong="H0705"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4427"\w*.

And they \w buried|strong="H6912"\w* him in his own \w sepulchres|strong="H6913"\w*, which he had \w made|strong="H3738"\w* for himself in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \w laid|strong="H7901"\w* him in the \w bed|strong="H4904"\w* which was \w filled|strong="H4390"\w* with sweet \w odours|strong="H1314"\w* and divers \w kinds|strong="H2177"\w* \add of spices\add* \w prepared|strong="H7543"\w* by the \w apothecaries’|strong="H4842"\w* \w art|strong="H4639"\w*: and they \w made|strong="H8313"\w* a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w burning|strong="H8316"\w* for him.\f + \fr 16.14 \ft had made: Heb. had digged\f*
